key_channel_insights.line_content: 94.18% of observed OTA prices were higher than the airline's website, indicating a significant premium.
74.9% of MSE prices matched the airline's website, highlighting strong consistency and competitive pricing.
Approximately 99% of fares on the GDS channel were listed higher than the airline's own website, showing a consistent pricing gap.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: In the latest week, 94.18% of observed prices on the OTA channel were higher than the airline's website.
Price difference percentages remained stable across the latest week with an average increase of just 0.11% across all records.
The 'Close In' booking window showed a marginally higher percentage of OTA prices compared to the airline's site, at 92.09%.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: There were no available offers in 1.96% of comparison instances, indicating minor visibility issues.
In 94.18% of instances, price comparisons revealed OTA offerings to be higher than the airline's site.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In the CO point-of-origin market, 93.82% of prices were higher on the OTA compared to the airline's site.
The Non-CO market presented higher OTA prices in 96.39% of cases, indicating a less competitive pricing strategy.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: The 'Close In' booking window showed a higher pricing frequency at 92.09%, indicating a tendency for inflated last-minute fares.
In the 'Far Out' window, OTA prices were higher 97.64% of the time, suggesting a rigid pricing strategy without early booking discounts.

mse_highlights.line_content: 74.9% of offerings in the MSE channel matched the airline's own website prices over the last week, indicating strong pricing consistency.
The MSE channel showed lower prices 23.1% of the time for short-haul routes, promoting competitive offerings in this category.
For long-haul routes, the MSE channel had a higher percentage of prices being lower compared to the website in the latest month, suggesting favorable conditions for cost-conscious travelers.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 74.9% of the sample recorded same prices between the MSE channel and the airline's official website last week, underscoring strong competitive alignment.
Only 0.6% of the offerings were priced higher on the MSE channel last week, reflecting limited instances of price premium over the official site.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Across all regions, price consistency was high, with significant proportions of listings being identical to website offers.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_title: Similar Patterns in CO and Non-CO
mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Both CO and Non-CO origin countries showed an overwhelming percentage of pricing at parity with the airline's website, with minimal deviations.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_title: Close In vs. Far Out Similarities
mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close in and far out bookings reflected comparable percentages of same-priced offers, with close in bookings slightly favoring lower prices.

gds_highlights.line_content: The GDS channel shows a consistent trend with approximately 99% of fares listed higher than the airline's own website.
In the latest week, GDS pricing was higher by an average of 0.44%, indicating a sustained pricing gap.
Offers from the GDS channel were lower than the website in just 0.03% of cases, highlighting a scarcity of competitive pricing.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: In the latest week, the GDS channel showed 99.23% of fares tagged as higher compared to the website.
Only 0.03% of the fares were reported as lower on the GDS, reflecting minimal competitive pricing.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: For short-haul flights, 99.49% of GDS prices were higher than the website, marking limited competitive fare options.
Long-haul itineraries maintained a high level of pricing uniformity with 94.87% of GDS fares exceeding website prices.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: In the CO group, GDS pricing was higher 99.77% of the time, suggesting potential pricing pressure in this market.
Non-CO origins exhibited 96.60% of fares in the GDS priced higher, emphasizing a consistent trend across all routes.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Among close-in bookings, 98.86% of fares were higher on the GDS, indicating limited pricing advantages for last-minute purchases.
For far-out bookings, 99.83% of offers were also priced higher, showing consistent higher pricing extended across different booking timelines.
